name: Mancinella

Head: Vertigo; head feels light, empty
Hair falls out after acute sickness
Scalp itches
Stomach: Vomiting of ingesta, followed by griping and copious stools
Continual choking sensation rising from stomach
Mouth: Dysphagia from constriction of throat and oesophagus
Nose: Illusions of smell; of gunpowder, dung, etc. Pressure at root of nose
Extremities: Icy coldness of hands and feet

details: Skin symptoms most marked. Dermatitis, with excessive vesiculation, oozing of sticky serum and formation of crusts. To be remembered in mental depressed states at puberty and at climacteric, with exalted sexuality. (HERING.) LOSS OF VISION. Pain in the THUMB.
